title: Mino Flip logo font
content:
I feel like this should be easy, but I haven’t been able to come up with a match.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090727131950im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Flip-Ultra-300x600_under45_4190.jpg)
author: solipsis

comments.content:
Kind of looks like a modified [ronda](http://web.archive.org/web/20090727131950/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/itc_ronda/)

p@rick
[Expressa](http://web.archive.org/web/20090727131950/http:/www.ascenderfonts.com/font/expressa.aspx) is close but doesn’t have the rounded l.
You guys are good... and quick! I looked at expressa because of the “a” but I am really looking for that “l” It’s so elusive.
More type of this style in [this list](http://web.archive.org/web/20090727131950/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/periods/bauhaus/).
Your link doesn’t link, Stephen. Did you mean [http://www.fontshop.com/fontcase/periods/bauhaus/](http://web.archive.org/web/20090727131950/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/periods/bauhaus/)?
which “l ” are you looking for, the one in the ultra or flip logo?
